events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle on the morning of May 10th, requesting immediate claim initiation.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and the keywords indicating a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage and process the filed auto accident claim for further follow-up.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the accident claim and assured the customer that the process was underway.
Requested necessary documents from the customer to verify the details of the car accident and to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all required documents, including accident photos and police report, which completed the initial documentation.
Investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision began, including contacting involved parties and reviewing submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded successfully with all facts verified and liability determined to proceed with the settlement.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on assessed damages and policy coverage for the auto accident.
The customer provided feedback indicating satisfaction with the settlement offer but requested clarification on payment timing.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance adjuster after verifying agreement on the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim was issued to the customerâ€™s specified bank account in full for the vehicle damages.
The claim was officially closed after confirming the customer received payment and expressed their satisfaction with the resolution.
